articles.title: Trump Exempts Some Electronics, Including Smartphones, From Tariffs on China
articles.content: President Trump’s tariff exemptions on some electronics are the latest twist in U.S. trade policy and could benefit companies such as Apple, Microsoft, Dell, Samsung and others that manufacture some products abroad.

articles.title: Apple, Nvidia Score Relief From US Tariffs With Exemptions
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- President Donald Trump’s administration exempted smartphones, computers and other electronics from its so-called reciprocal tariffs, representing a major reprieve for global technology manufacturers including Apple Inc. and Nvidia Corp. even if it proves a temporary one.Most Read from BloombergThe Secret Formula for Faster TrainsIn Chicago, a Former Steel Mill Looks to Make a Quantum LeapMidtown Office Building Evacuated on Concerns of Wall CollapseNYC Tourist Helicopter Crashes i

articles.title: Apple, Nvidia, Dell, and Others Get a Tariffs Exemption Under New Rules
articles.content: Smartphones, PCs, and servers won’t face the highest tariffs rates, according to a document from the U.S. Customs and Border Protection Agency.

articles.title: Apple, Nvidia, and Microsoft can 'breathe a huge sigh of relief' after Trump's China tariff exemptions
articles.content: The ever-growing U.S. tariffs on imports from China won’t bite Big Tech so badly after all, after the Trump administration late Friday laid out significant exemptions from its wider trade war that include smartphones, laptop computers, chips, and more.

articles.title: Jim Cramer On Apple Inc. (AAPL): “Own Apple, Don’t Trade It!”
articles.content: We recently published a list of Jim Cramer Discussed These 12 Stocks. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Apple Inc. articles.title: US exempts smartphones from reciprocal tariffs, seen as positive for Apple
articles.content: Investing.com -- Late Friday, the United States took a step that could be favorable for tech companies like Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) by exempting certain electronics from the reciprocal tariffs previously imposed by President Donald Trump. The U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) released a list late on Friday, detailing around 20 products that would no longer be subject to these tariffs. Items on the list include smartphones, computers, semiconductor-based transducers, solid-state storage device

articles.title: Smartphones and computers are now exempt from Trump’s latest tariffs
articles.content: Electronics imported to the United States will be exempt from President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs, according to a US Customs and Border Protection notice posted on Friday.

articles.title: Trump administration says it will exclude some electronics from 'reciprocal' tariffs
articles.content: The Trump administration says it will exclude electronics like smartphones and laptops from 'reciprocal' tariffs, a move that could help keep the prices down.

articles.title: Trump spares smartphones, computers, other electronics from China tariffs
articles.content: WASHINGTON/WEST PALM BEACH, Florida -President Donald Trump's administration granted exclusions from steep reciprocal tariffs to smartphones, computers and some other electronics imported largely...

articles.title: Mark Zuckerberg's empire at stake as Meta prepares to battle Trump's antitrust cops in court
articles.content: Meta is preparing for the start of a courtroom battle Monday with the US government in an antitrust case that could force Mark Zuckerberg to break up his $1.3 trillion empire and sell one of its crown jewels: Instagram.
